intro: Bumelia altamiranoi, commonly known as the Mexican bumelia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often reddish stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers that are typically inconspicuous. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Bumelia altamiranoi is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical uses are not well-documented.
